cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP1 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Hurricane Fernanda Advisory Number 25 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP062017 800 PM PDT Mon Jul 17 2017
...FERNANDA WEAKENS TO A CATEGORY 2 HURRICANE...
SUMMARY OF 800 PM PDT...0300 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...14.7N 132.2W ABOUT 1560 MI...2515 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA ABOUT 1550 MI...2490 KM E OF HILO HAWAII MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...110 MPH...175 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...NW OR 310 DEGREES AT 9 MPH...15 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...967 MB...28.56 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 800 PM PDT (0300 UTC), the center of Hurricane Fernanda was located near latitude 14.7 North, longitude 132.2 West. Fernanda is moving toward the northwest near 9 mph (15 km/h), and a generally northwestward motion at a slightly slower forward speed is expected over the next couple of days.
Maximum sustained winds have decreased to near 110 mph (175 km/h) with higher gusts. Fernanda is a category 2 hurricane on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale. Continued gradual weakening is forecast during the next couple of days.
Hurricane-force winds extend outward up to 30 miles (45 km) from the center, and tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 115 miles (185 km).
The estimated minimum central pressure is 967 mb (28.56 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 200 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Roberts
NNNN
